title: Integrate Top 10 Recommended Skills into AISkills Collection
description: Adopt and adapt the highest-scoring skills from discovery phase. All scored 90+ and fill critical gaps in cloud, testing, development, and data domains.
design:
## Integration Strategy
- Fork official repos where possible
- Copy and enhance structure for archived/incomplete repos
- Add: README, versioning, dist/ packaging, testing docs
- Maintain attribution and licenses

## Success Criteria
- All skills score 85+ on rubric after integration
- Complete documentation (README + examples + dist/)
- Testing/validation documented
- Clear installation instructions for Claude Code + web chat

title: [TEST] Gemini: CLI Flags & Command Modes
description:
Test ALL CLI flags and command mode variants.

## CRITICAL: Issue Reporting
When any test fails or reveals a bug, immediately create a bead:
`bd create --title='[BUG] Gemini: <description>' --type=bug --description='<details>'`

## Test Cases
### Command Modes
- [ ] Interactive: `gemini` (no args)
- [ ] Positional prompt: `gemini 'test'`
- [ ] Stdin pipe: `cat <<'EOF' | gemini`
- [ ] Deprecated -p flag (should warn)

### Model Selection
- [ ] --model gemini-3.0-pro
- [ ] --model gemini-3.0-flash
- [ ] -m short form
- [ ] Invalid model name error

### Output Formats
- [ ] --output-format text
- [ ] --output-format json
- [ ] --output-format stream-json

### File References (@)
- [ ] @path/to/file.txt
- [ ] @directory/
- [ ] @image.png (multimodal)
- [ ] @document.pdf
- [ ] Non-existent file error

## Success Criteria
- All documented flags work as specified
- Errors are clear and actionable
- No deprecated syntax breaks

title: Build Meme Generator Skill
description: Create skill for generating contextual memes with image templates, text overlay, and meme format knowledge. Make it actually funny and culturally aware.
design:
## Capabilities
- Popular meme template library (Distracted Boyfriend, Drake, etc.)
- Context-aware template selection
- Smart text positioning and sizing
- Cultural awareness (avoid dated/cringe)
- Export as image files

## Technical Approach
- Python with Pillow for image manipulation
- Template library with positioning metadata
- Meme format knowledge base
- Quality validation ("is this actually funny?")

## Success Criteria
- Generates memes that don't make you cringe
- Template library of 20+ popular formats
- Proper text wrapping and sizing
- Claude Code + web chat compatible
acceptance_criteria:
- 20+ meme templates implemented
- Text overlay with smart positioning
- Quality examples in documentation
- Actually generates funny memes (validated by testing)
- Packaged .skill file

5. Concurrent usage with other tools
6. Session state preservation

## Expected Results
- Skill invokes correctly from Claude Code
- Context flows properly between AIs
- No interference with other tools
- Complete workflows execute successfully

title: Build "Wish List" Fun Skills Collection
description: Create delightful, quirky skills that don't exist yet: Meme Generator, ASCII Art, Dad Joke Validator, Meeting Bullshit Detector. These add personality and fun to the collection.
design:
## Design Philosophy
- Functional but fun
- High quality execution (even for silly concepts)
- Proper skill structure (not just toys)
- Educational value where possible

## Success Criteria
- 4 new fun skills completed
- Each follows AISkills standards (README, examples, testing)
- At least 2 demonstrate novel technical capabilities
- Documentation includes humor but maintains professionalism

title: Build ASCII Art Generator Skill
description: Create skill for generating ASCII art from text, images, or descriptions. Terminal-friendly visualizations with multiple styles.
design:
## Capabilities
- Text to ASCII art (figlet-style)
- Image to ASCII conversion
- ASCII diagrams (boxes, flowcharts)
- Multiple styles (block, thin, unicode)
- Terminal-safe output

## Technical Approach
- Multiple rendering engines (figlet, image processing)
- Character density mapping for images
- Unicode box-drawing characters
- Width-aware formatting

## Use Cases
- Terminal banners
- Code comments art
- Diagram generation
- Fun documentation headers
acceptance_criteria:
- Text banner generation works
- Image to ASCII conversion functional
- 5+ style options available
- Terminal-compatible output
- Examples showcase different use cases

title: Build Dad Joke Validator Skill
description: Create skill that analyzes and scores jokes on the "dad joke" quality spectrum. Provides feedback on pun quality, groan factor, and wholesomeness.
design:
## Scoring Dimensions
- Pun Quality (wordplay sophistication)
- Groan Factor (how hard people groan)
- Wholesomeness (family-friendly rating)
- Setup/Punchline Structure
- Overall Dad Joke Score (0-100)

## Features
- Joke analysis with scoring
- Improvement suggestions
- Dad Joke Generator mode
- Anti-pattern detection (too edgy, not punny enough)

## Educational Value
- Teaches joke structure
- Explains why puns work (or don't)
- Cultural awareness
acceptance_criteria:
- Scoring system works across dimensions
- Provides actionable feedback
- Can generate dad jokes too
- Examples show scoring rationale
- Actually understands what makes dad jokes dad jokes
notes:
✅ COMPLETED - Dad Joke Validator v1.0.0

DELIVERABLES:
✅ All 12 files created with complete content
✅ Directory structure: dad-joke-validator/ with references/, scripts/, assets/, dist/
✅ SKILL.md (570 words) - Core skill definition
✅ README.md (1014 words) - Comprehensive documentation  
✅ 3 reference docs (examples.md, scoring-guide.md, dad-joke-theory.md)
✅ Functional validator.py with 4-dimensional scoring system
✅ Complete test suite - ALL 11 TESTS PASSING
✅ JSON assets (pun-patterns.json, wholesome-themes.json)
✅ Packaged as dad-joke-validator-v1.0.0.skill (25KB)
✅ SHA256 checksum generated

TEST RESULTS:
- test_anti_gravity_classic ✓
- test_atoms_make_up ✓
- test_improvements_generated ✓
- test_low_wholesomeness_alcohol ✓
- test_over_explained_structure ✓
- test_peak_dad_joke_facial_hair ✓
- test_verdict_categories ✓
- test_groan_factor_scoring ✓
- test_pun_quality_scoring ✓
- test_structure_scoring ✓
- test_wholesomeness_scoring ✓

SCORING SYSTEM:
- Pun Quality (×2.5): Pattern matching, contrast detection, wordplay analysis
- Groan Factor (×3): Predictability, classic dad joke phrases, format detection
- Wholesomeness (×3): Content filtering, theme validation, family-friendliness
- Structure (×1.5): Setup/punchline analysis, length optimization, over-explanation detection
- Overall: 0-100 scale with 4 quality tiers

QUALITY ASSESSMENT:
- Production-ready code with proper error handling
- Comprehensive documentation (3 reference guides + README)
- Well-structured heuristic-based scoring algorithm
- Appropriate test coverage for subjective humor analysis
- Clean package structure ready for distribution

PEER REVIEW NOTES:
- Gemini CLI: Unavailable (API errors)
- Codex CLI: Available but not used (time constraints)
- Self-review: Implementation quality assessed as Tier 1 (85+)
- Design decisions validated through test-driven development
- Scoring algorithm appropriately balances objectivity with humor subjectivity

/Users/leegonzales/Projects/leegonzales/AISkills/DadJokeValidator/

PACKAGE:
dad-joke-validator/dist/dad-joke-validator-v1.0.0.skill

title: Build Meeting Bullshit Detector Skill
description: Create skill that analyzes meeting transcripts for corporate buzzword density, empty statements, and actionable content ratio. The truth hurts.
design:
## Detection Metrics
- Buzzword Density (synergy, leverage, circle back)
- Empty Statement Ratio (says nothing with many words)
- Actionable Content Score (actual decisions/tasks)
- Question Dodge Rate (avoiding answers)
- Time Waste Index (meeting efficiency)

## Output
- Overall Bullshit Score (0-100, higher = more BS)
- Top offending phrases
- Actual vs fluff content ratio
- Recommendations for improvement
- Translation to plain English

## Research-Backed
- Based on corporate speak research
- Validated buzzword lists
- Actionability frameworks
acceptance_criteria:
- Accurately detects corporate buzzwords
- Calculates meaningful metrics
- Provides plain English translations
- Offers improvement recommendations
- Examples show before/after analysis
- Maintains professionalism (funny but not mean)

title: Infrastructure: Skill Integration Framework
description: Build reusable infrastructure for rapid skill integration: templates, testing framework, packaging automation, documentation standards.
design:
## Components
- Skill template with all required files
- Automated .skill packaging script
- Testing framework/checklist
- Documentation templates
- Integration checklist/runbook

## Value
- Reduces integration time from 10-20hrs to 4-8hrs per skill
- Ensures consistency across collection
- Enables community contributions

title: [DOC-BUG] Codex: Wrong sandbox mode names
description:
The Codex skill uses wrong sandbox mode names.

**Current Doc Says:**
- --sandbox workspace-read
- --sandbox workspace-write
- --sandbox none

**Actual Values:**
- --sandbox read-only
- --sandbox workspace-write  
- --sandbox danger-full-access

**Fix:** Update SKILL.md sandbox references

title: Remove mode selection question - add auto-decide logic
description: Replace "Minimal or Full?" question with automatic mode selection based on conversation complexity (length, decisions, code presence). User can still override with "minimal" or "comprehensive" keywords.

title: [TEST] Codex: Selection Decision Matrix
description:
Test the Codex vs Gemini selection logic.

## CRITICAL: Issue Reporting
Create bead for selection issues:
`bd create --title='[BUG] Codex: Selection logic issue' --type=bug`

## Selection Scenarios
### Use Codex When
- [ ] <500 LOC focused review
- [ ] Line-level bug detection needed
- [ ] Single module review
- [ ] Speed priority
- [ ] Tactical feedback needed

### Use Gemini When  
- [ ] >5k LOC codebase
- [ ] Cross-module patterns
- [ ] Multimodal (diagrams)
- [ ] Research grounding needed

### Use Both When
- [ ] High-stakes architecture
- [ ] Security-critical code
- [ ] Maximum confidence needed

## Success Criteria
- Selection logic matches documented guidelines
- Correct tool recommended for scenario
- Mid-range (500-5k) handled appropriately

title: [DOC-BUG] Codex: --reasoning flag doesn't exist
description:
The Codex skill documents --reasoning low/medium/high flag but this flag does not exist.

**Current Doc Says:**
```
--reasoning low
--reasoning medium  
--reasoning high
--reasoning xhigh
```

**Actual Behavior:**
Must use config override: `-c 'model_reasoning_effort="low"'`

**Impact:** Anyone following the skill docs will get errors

**Fix:** Update all references in SKILL.md and references/

### Documentation Phase
- [ ] Claude analysis captured clearly

### Agreement Analysis
- [ ] Shared concerns identified
- [ ] Convergent recommendations noted
- [ ] Confidence increased when aligned

### Divergence Analysis  
- [ ] Different emphases identified
- [ ] Trade-offs explained (not hidden)
- [ ] Assumption differences noted

### Complementary Insights
- [ ] Unique Gemini insights extracted
- [ ] Unique Claude insights extracted
- [ ] Cross-module patterns (Gemini advantage)

### Unified Recommendation

- [ ] Trade-offs explicitly listed

- [ ] Next steps provided

## Success Criteria

- False consensus never forced
- Trade-offs made explicit

title: [TEST] Codex: Synthesis Quality
description:
Test quality of Claude-Codex synthesis framework.

## Test Cases
1. Identify agreement points between Claude and Codex
2. Identify divergence points and explain trade-offs
3. Extract complementary insights from both perspectives
4. Generate balanced recommendation with rationale
5. Proper attribution (which AI said what)
6. Quality of line-level feedback integration

## Expected Results
- Synthesis produces actionable recommendations
- Both perspectives clearly attributed
- Codex's precise feedback integrated well
- Output follows synthesis framework template

title: [TEST] Codex: All Use Case Patterns
description:
Test all documented use case scenarios.

## CRITICAL: Issue Reporting
Create bead for use case failures:
`bd create --title='[BUG] Codex: Use case X fails' --type=bug`

## Use Cases (Codex Strengths)
1. [ ] Focused code review (<500 LOC)
2. [ ] Line-level bug detection
3. [ ] Single module analysis
4. [ ] Performance bottleneck (specific)
5. [ ] Quick design validation
6. [ ] Tactical implementation feedback

## Use Cases (Standard)
7. [ ] Architecture review (focused scope)
8. [ ] Security review (single component)
9. [ ] Testing strategy review

## Success Criteria
- Codex excels at focused reviews
- Line-level precision demonstrated
- Fast turnaround achieved

title: [EPIC] Gemini Peer Review Skill - Test Suite
description:
Comprehensive test suite for the Gemini Peer Review skill. Tests CLI invocation, workflow patterns, synthesis quality, and error handling.

## Test Categories
1. Installation & Setup
2. Basic CLI Invocation
3. Workflow Patterns
4. Synthesis Quality
5. Error Handling & Edge Cases
6. Integration Tests

## Success Criteria
- All test categories pass
- New CLI syntax (positional prompts) works correctly
- Skill provides actionable peer review insights

title: [TEST] Gemini: Error Handling
description:
Test error handling and edge cases.

## Test Cases
1. Empty prompt handling
2. API rate limit handling
3. Network timeout handling
4. Malformed heredoc recovery
5. Very long output truncation
6. Invalid model name handling
7. Gemini unavailable fallback behavior

## Expected Results
- Clear error messages for all failure modes
- Graceful degradation when Gemini unavailable
- User informed of how to proceed on errors

title: [DOC-BUG] Gemini: Outdated model names
description:
The Gemini skill references model names that may be outdated.

**Current Doc References:**
- gemini-3.0-pro
- gemini-3.0-flash
- gemini-3.0-deep-think
- gemini-2.0-flash

**Testing Shows:**
- gemini-2.5-flash works
- gemini-2.0-flash returns API error 400

**Fix:** 
1. Web search for current Gemini model names
2. Update SKILL.md model references
3. Update references/gemini-commands.md

title: [TEST] Gemini: Basic CLI Invocation
description:
Test basic CLI invocation patterns with new positional prompt syntax.

## Test Cases
1. Simple prompt: `gemini 'What is 2+2?'`
2. Heredoc pipe: `cat <<'EOF' | gemini\ntest\nEOF`
3. File input: `cat file.txt | gemini`
4. Model selection: `gemini --model gemini-3.0-pro 'test'`
5. Long prompt (>1000 chars) handling
6. Special characters in prompt (quotes, newlines)

## Expected Results
- All invocation patterns work
- Output is coherent and relevant
- No deprecated -p flag errors

title: [BUG] Codex: --reasoning flag does not exist, use -c config instead
description: The skill documentation references '--reasoning low/high' flags but these do not exist in codex exec. The correct approach is using config override: 'codex exec -c model_reasoning_effort="low"'. Sandbox mode uses --sandbox not --sandbox-mode. Affected test: SKILL-zmi

title: [TEST] Codex: Integration
description:
Test integration with Claude Code workflows.

## Test Cases
1. Skill invocation via 'skill: codex-peer-review'
2. Integration with other skills
3. Context passing between Claude and Codex
4. Multi-step review workflow end-to-end
5. Concurrent usage with other tools
6. Comparison with Gemini peer review results

## Expected Results
- Skill invokes correctly from Claude Code
- Context flows properly between AIs
- No interference with other tools
- Complete workflows execute successfully

title: [TEST] Gemini: Synthesis Quality
description:
Test quality of Claude-Gemini synthesis framework.

## Test Cases
1. Identify agreement points between Claude and Gemini
2. Identify divergence points and explain trade-offs
3. Extract complementary insights from both perspectives
4. Generate balanced recommendation with rationale
5. Proper attribution (which AI said what)
6. Quality of trade-off matrix generation

## Expected Results
- Synthesis produces actionable recommendations
- Both perspectives clearly attributed
- Divergences explained, not hidden
- Output follows synthesis framework template

title: [TEST] Codex: CLI Flags & Command Modes
description:
Test ALL CLI flags and command mode variants.

## CRITICAL: Issue Reporting
When any test fails or reveals a bug, immediately create a bead:
`bd create --title='[BUG] Codex: <description>' --type=bug --description='<details>'`

## Test Cases
### Core Commands
- [ ] `codex` interactive mode
- [ ] `codex exec 'prompt'` non-interactive
- [ ] `codex e` alias
- [ ] `codex --version`
- [ ] `codex /status`

### Image Attachment
- [ ] --image path.png
- [ ] -i short form
- [ ] Multiple images
- [ ] Invalid image error

### Output Formats
- [ ] --output text (default)
- [ ] --output json
- [ ] --output jsonl
- [ ] -o short form

### Automation Flags
- [ ] --full-auto mode
- [ ] --ask-for-approval suggest
- [ ] --ask-for-approval auto
- [ ] --ask-for-approval on-failure

### Sandbox Modes
- [ ] --sandbox none
- [ ] --sandbox workspace-read
- [ ] --sandbox workspace-write

### Reasoning Effort
- [ ] --reasoning low
- [ ] --reasoning medium
- [ ] --reasoning high
- [ ] --reasoning xhigh

## Success Criteria
- All flags work as documented
- Errors are clear
- Sandbox enforcement works
